intro: Brodiaea coronaria var. kernensis, commonly known as the Kern's brodiaea, is a flowering plant native to California's Central Valley. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
